fields.description:
With the amount of pull requests we have on a daily basis, within our organisation we often end up getting spammed with emails from pull requests. Unwatching each pull request we get added to is not a practical solution in this case.

 

We would like the ability to just suppress ALL email notifications including pull request notifications on a per user basis. This would greatly reduce the noise in our email inboxes.
fields.summary: Add ability to turn off email notifications for a user

fields.description:
Is it possible for Atlassian to offer a more robust commit checker than what is available in the marketplace out of the box? It seems appropriate that this feature resides in vanilla Bitbucket.

Features we would like to see:
 * Easy Global Configuration Setup
 ** Can be applied to all projects by default with the ability to exclude projects.
 ** Can be applied on a per project or per repository basis
 * Ability to prevent commits that don't match certain regex's
 * Ability to prevent commits that don't contain valid Jira issue ids
 * Have all these features all work when attempting to commit using the UI in-line editor.
 * etc

 

Thanks!
fields.summary: In-House Commit Checker
Would like to have a Rest API which return the CommitID using a file in a non-default Branch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to start Bitbucket 6.7+ with MySQL database from Aurora, it fails to state an unsupported database.
h3. Environment

Bitbucket 6.7.0
Aurora DB MySQL


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have an instance pre-6.7 connected to Aurora MySQL (runs without issue)
 # Upgrade to 6.7.0

h3. Expected Results
Should start without issue. Showing a warning in the logs mentioning an unsupported database.

h3. Actual Results

Bitbucket fails to start stating:

{code}
The configured database is unsupported
{code}


h3. Workaround


Restore to a backup from before the upgrade. Since migrating to a supported database is supported from the Database Migration wizard (and that is only accessible from the UI), you wouldn't be able to migrate after the upgrade without running a database dump and reimporting it.
fields.summary: Trying to start Bitbucket Server with Aurora MySQL fails.

fields.description:
h6. Problem Definition
Clients would like to have the ability to encrypt data at rest in Bitbucket on-premise (including DC environments) as they do for Bitbucket Cloud. 


h6. Suggested Solution

As this was added in Bitbucket in Cloud, can we add this into Bitbucket on-premise features as well?

May be a a property to encrypt data that can be added to {{Bitbucket.properties}} file or/and a setting to to turn on/off data encryption at REST.

h6. Why this is important
Commonly, it is a requirement from internal security auditing teams.
fields.summary: Encryption at rest for Bitbucket

fields.description:
h3. Description
In a certain cases when the user management is deleaged to a remote team managing LDAP directory it can be required to quickly share the repository access with a wide auditory to facilitate cross-project collaboration.
With a current functionality it can be done in two ways which have certain disadvantages:
* Create a group to have all the users (or keep stash-users as such group) and share it with the group. Disadvantage here is that it creates additional complexity in the permissions and user management while not giving indication that the repository is shared with a wide audience.
* Enable [public access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/allowing-public-access-to-code-776639799.html]. Such option will give the anonymous read access to the repository which is not acceptable for some environments like fintech, banking etc, when all the access should be logged and no anonymous access allowed.

h3. Solution
Provide the option of the public access to be enabled with "anonymous access" and "licensed-only access".
fields.summary: Provide the option for Public access to enable it only for the licensed users

fields.description:
As a development lead I would like to configure a limit for the number of branches in a Bitbucket repository so that I can better control run-away branches and keep my repositories clean.

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*
 * Project owners can set the maximum number of branches in a project
 * Repos will inherit the maximum number from project level
 * Repos branch limits can be overwritten as needed
 * Branch limits can be set by API
fields.summary: Limit number of Branches in a repository

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When Searching for repositories in slack, it is impossible to differentiate repositories named identically across multiple projects. An example from a screenshot

!Screenshot 2019-10-10 at 10.49.56.png|width=287,height=311!  
h3. Suggestion

It would be a good feature to append the branch key to the search result, to help differentiate between repositories.
fields.summary: Improve Slack Search

fields.description:
Currently, email push notifications include the commit hash, the author, and the message.

It would be useful to also display more information, such as the branch the commit modifies, and the paths modified by the push.
fields.summary: It would be useful to include the paths modified in push notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When searching a commit ID with the Compare function in Bitbucket 6.6.2 an error occurs when there is an ambiguous SHA in Git as shown below.

'/usr/bin/git rev-list --format=%H%x02%P%x02%aN%x02%aE%x02%at%x02%cN%x02%cE%x02%ct%n%B%n%x03END%x04 --no-walk=unsorted 9caa 9caa^@ --' exited with code 128 saying: error: short SHA1 9caa is ambiguous hint: The candidates are: hint: 9caa054acac commit 2017-07-20 - Automatic merge hint: 9caa8530402 commit 2013-03-18 - Merge branch 'master' into STASH-2508-spike-git-protocol-support hint: 9caaacd4528 commit 2017-05-08 - BSERVDEV-15183: Moving to IndexEventQueueProcessor for filter hint: 9caa01ef3a5 tree hint: 9caa040ee26 tree hint: 9caa08d9e52 tree hint: 9caa1db52d0 tree hint: 9caa1fa278b tree hint: 9caa3ce661a tree hint: 9caa4b1c2bb tree hint: 9caa4be9d6e tree hint: 9caa51389be tree hint: 9caa53e66e6 tree hint: 9caa59382ea tree hint: 9caa598af58 tree hint: 9caa607ad60 tree hint: 9caa6477cc7 tree hint: 9caa65859ac tree hint: 9caa73d0bbc tree hint: 9caa7584091 tree hint: 9caa78e0d58 tree hint: 9caa7bb570a tree hint: 9caa83d1e1a tree hint: 9caa8709a88 tree hint: 9caa95a5655 tree hint: 9caa96ece7e tree hint: 9caa9f2725f tree hint: 9caaa4bfe88 tree hint: 9caac3b7ad9 tree hint: 9caac53b6ea tree hint: 9caac6fce7f tree hint: 9caac8a1f71 tree hint: 9caac9bc0a8 tree hint: 9caacf4901b tree hint: 9caad6d7010 tree hint: 9caae358120 tree hint: 9caaee7337b tree hint: 9caaf271911 tree hint: 9caaf6d4c9d tree hint: 9caa1798007 blob hint: 9caa2e552f3 blob hint: 9caa31c6827 blob hint: 9caa61fd35a blob hint: 9caa85a6789 blob hint: 9caaae7cf36 blob hint: 9caad9d4475 blob hint: 9caafa14dc8 blob fatal: bad revision '9caa'
{code}

h3. Environment
Bitbucket 6.6.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to {{*Repository->Compare->Commits*}} tab
# Search for a Commit ID with with ambiguous SHA in Git

h3. Expected Results
List of commit IDs with similar SHA

Error: {{*"error: short SHA1 9caa is ambiguous hint: The candidates are: hint: 9caa054acac"*}}

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Sometimes a build is stopped in a CI tool and that does not mean the build is _Failed_. In Bamboo, for example, the *not built* or *never built* statuses don't mean there is an issue with the source code. Given that those statuses don't mean a failed build, they need a better status to represent them in the Bitbucket server.
h3. Suggested solution

Add an extra build status called STOPPED. This could represent that a build was stopped without sharing that there is an issue with the build. This status is already available in Bitbucket cloud and adding it to BBS will help Atlassian tools to speak the same language to users.
fields.summary: Add the STOPPED build status in Bitbucket server

fields.description:
The ability to link between Jira projects and Bitbucket projects feature was introduced in version 6.6.0. 

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-4800

Although it is a nice property it is not enough for some cases.

Case: A Bitbucket project may have repositories from different Jira projects. That is, Bitbucket and Jira may not have the same project approach.

Status: Not handled, not supported. I find it logical that this feature can be used between Bitbucket repositorys and Jira projects.
fields.summary: Project Links for Repository

fields.description:
While you can still prevent a pull request to be merged without a reviewer, it would be beneficial to define a requirement that reviewers must be added  at pull-request creation.

If the addition of reviewers to PRs is marked as required at the project or repository level by the project/repository administrator, the "Create" button should be greyed out until the developer adds at least one reviewer in the pull request.
fields.summary: Add option to prevent pull request creation without a reviewer

fields.description:
h4.  Current documentation

Our current documentation on pull request suggestions under the section *Pull request suggestions* in the document [Review and discuss a pull request|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/review-and-discuss-a-pull-request-808488540.html] is not very comprehensive.

Specifically point 1:
 # In the comment dialog, click   !https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/files/808488540/976171918/1/1566880110686/pr-suggestions-icon-cac.png|width=20! .
 may lead users to try this on a pull request comment, where the button is greyed out, since pull request suggestions can only be applied to a combined diff view of the pull request.

h4. Suggestion

Add the following:
 # Navigate to a pull request
 # Instead of *Overview* click on *Diff*
 # Hover the mouse over a line of code, until you can click on the line of code to add a comment. (the video in [Bitbucket Server 6.6 release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-6-6-release-notes-975023322.html] under *Suggest changes directly in pull requests* is very instructive.)
 # Now in the line comment you *should* see a clickable pull request suggestion button.
fields.summary: Improve documentation on pull request suggestions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment

Slack notification plugin 2.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure the Slack notification plugin.
 # Enable all the notifications in a repository.
 # Create a new branch out of the existing one.

h3. Expected Results

Bitbucket ServerAPP 1:12 PM
 NAME *created branch* custom/SOMETHING in PROJECT/REPOSITORY
h3. Actual Results

Bitbucket ServerAPP 1:12 PM
 NAME pushed 7+ commits to custom/SOMETHING in PROJECT/REPOSITORY
 <COMMIT 1>
 <COMMIT 2>
 <COMMIT 3>
h3. Notes

_Technically_ the message is correct, as the commits are pushed to the new branch while it's being created, however, it's misleading and doesn't differentiate new branch creation from pushing commits to a branch and there's a specific option for "New branch creation".
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating a new branch in a repository with Slack plugin enabled sends incomplete message if all notifications are enabled

fields.description:
This request is for Bitbucket Server for Slack Official ([https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220729/bitbucket-server-for-slack-official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220729/bitbucket-server-for-slack-official?hosting=server&tab=support]

Please add the ability to configure Slack notification settings at the Project level as well as the repository level.  For large organizations managing per repository settings is very time consuming.  Setting a project level setting that is inherited and can possibly be overwritten at the repository level (with some capability to snap back repositories if needed) would save a lot of effort
fields.summary: Add the ability to configure Slack notifications at the project level, not just repository level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While the {{AuditService}} _class file_ is available for apps to reference, the _actual service_ is not OSGi-exported and cannot be used. Any app which attempts to use {{AuditService}} will fail to start.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a {{<component-import/>}} or {{@ComponentImport}} for {{AuditService}}

h3. Expected Results

The app successfully imports the {{AuditService}}.

h3. Actual Results

The app fails to start with an error like the following:
{noformat}
[INFO] 2019-01-01 11:11:11,111 ERROR [spring-startup]  c.a.plugin.osgi.factory.OsgiPlugin Plugin 'com.example.myplugin' never resolved service '&auditService' with filter '(objectClass=com.atlassian.bitbucket.audit.AuditService)'
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround for this issue. It will require a software fix in Bitbucket Server, and any app that _requires_ the {{AuditService}} will only be able to work when deployed to a fixed version.
fields.summary: AuditService is not available for apps

fields.description: It has the word "recreate" hyperlinked pointing to a feature request for migrating repositories. Unfortunately, it states in that sentence "But note that you need to recreate all metadata such as permissions, comments, pull requests etc." which makes it seem like the ability to recreate all that metadata is possible (it is not) because the ticket is closed. That line should either be removed or linked to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-4554 instead.
fields.summary: Bitbucket: Migrate Bitbucket Cloud to Bitbucket Server document needs an update

fields.description: [https://bitbucket.status.atlassian.com/history]  includes a button "report a problem" that redirects to [https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-server/] This is absurd, you do not go to Jira to report a status. Nor even the forums.
fields.summary: Remove "Report a Problem" from status web page

fields.description:
When going to a Bitbucket project view you are presented with a table with all the repositories on that project.

This table is basically empty as it just lists the repository name on the left side, and a star on the right side, that allows you to favorite a repo.

It would be more useful if this table could show other columns with information about each repo. I'm especially interested in seeing the *open pull requests* on the repo. This helps me during the release process where I can see with a quick view, if there are pending things to merge in different repos. Now, I have to click on each repo to get that information.
fields.summary: Show number of open Pull Requests on the project overview

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There are several use-cases where files that contain sensitive information are tracked in Bitbucket Server. There is a need to extend the Audit logging functionality to include audit logging for read access to such files. The logging should include *both the access username and access source IP address.*
h3. Suggestion
 # Ability to define specific files to be tracked for audit logging
 # Audit logging for all read access of the file using git or web interface
 #  If the logging for the specified file has been disabled, there should be a log for the user performing such an action
fields.summary: File level access Audit logging

fields.description:
We would like to be able to *enable* the in-browser file editing feature for _some_ projects/repositories and *disable* this feature for other projects/repositories.

Currently, we can only enable or disable this feature globally (for the entire Bitbucket instance), which makes it impossible to satisfy the different requirements of _*all*_ the repositories.
fields.summary: Ability to enable/disable in-browser editing per repository

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Git LFS currently supports basic auth and NTLM with SSPI. However, there is no support for negotiate auth (Kerberos ticket-based authentication).

This feature request is based on a customer's request and is quoted here:
{quote}
I'm pretty sure Basic auth does work for LFS for us. I can use my username and password with LFS tasks. The issue is, the majority of our users don't have usernames and passwords. They use SSO with government PIV cards. That is why we need LFS to use negotiate, so they can authenticate.
{quote}

h2. Workarounds
# Switch to basic auth
# Use NTML with SSPI
fields.summary: Add support for negotiate auth in Git LFS

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the Windows Service for the bundled Elasticsearch instance is created by the Bitbucket Windows installer, the default Java options prevent the Elasticsearch service from starting.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install [AdoptOpenJDK11|https://adoptopenjdk.net/releases.html?variant=openjdk11&jvmVariant=hotspot#x64_win] or an equivalent distribution of Java 11, and set the {{JAVA_HOME}} and {{JRE_HOME}} environment variables to this installed JDK
 # Run the Bitbucket installer, select {{Install Bitbucket Server}}, and opt to create the Windows Services.
 #* (!) The Elasticsearch instance then needs to be manually pointed to use the JDK11 instance - see BSERV-11985
 # After install completes, [open the settings of the Elasticsearch Windows service|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserverkb/how-to-update-the-jvm-configuration-for-a-windows-service-800715342.html]
# On the *{{Java}}* tab, change the JVM to the Java 11 instance that was installed in step 1

h3. Expected Results

Either the Elasticsearch service works when manually switched to JDK11, or the installer recognizes that JDK11 is installed and then configures the Windows Services appropriately on creation

* (!) The installer may not recognize installed Java 11 instances and automatically configure the Windows Services to use those instead - see BSERV-11985 

h3. Actual Results

The service fails to start, and the following exception is thrown in the {{AtlassianBitbucketElasticsearch.<DATE>.log}} file:

{noformat}
[2019-09-26 20:48:46] [info]  [  916] Commons Daemon procrun (1.0.15.0 64-bit) started
[2019-09-26 20:48:46] [info]  [  916] Running 'AtlassianBitbucketElasticsearch' Service...
[2019-09-26 20:48:46] [info]  [ 1460] Starting service...
[2019-09-26 20:48:46] [error] [ 2568] CreateJavaVM Failed
[2019-09-26 20:48:46] [error] [ 2568] The system cannot find the file specified.
[2019-09-26 20:48:46] [error] [ 1460] Failed to start Java
[2019-09-26 20:48:46] [error] [ 1460] ServiceStart returned 4
[2019-09-26 20:48:46] [info]  [  916] Run service finished.
[2019-09-26 20:48:46] [info]  [  916] Commons Daemon procrun finished
{noformat}

* (i) This exception is also thrown in the System section of the Windows Event Viewer

h3. Workaround

Remove the following entries from the *{{Java Options}}* section of the *{{Java}}* tab in the [Elasticsearch Windows Service configuration window|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserverkb/how-to-update-the-jvm-configuration-for-a-windows-service-800715342.html]:

{noformat}
-XX:+PrintGCDetails
-XX:+PrintGCDateStamps
-XX:+PrintTenuringDistribution
-XX:+PrintGCApplicationStoppedTime
-Xloggc:<PATH_TO_GC_LOGS>
-XX:+UseGCLogFileRotation
-XX:NumberOfGCLogFiles=32
-XX:GCLogFileSize=64m
{noformat}

* (i) Adding back the following options will retain the ability to log GC activity:
** {{-Xlog:safepoint,gc*,gc+age*=trace:file=<PATH_TO_GC_LOGS>:time:filecount=32,filesize=64m}}
fields.summary: Bundled Elasticsearch Windows Service default settings incompatible with Java 11

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When JDK11 is installed and appropriately configured on a Windows server, the Bitbucket installer still extracts and configures itself to use the bundled JRE.

h3. Environment

 * Any [compatible version|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/supported-platforms-776640981.html] of Windows Server
* AdoptOpenJDK11 or other Java 11 equivalent is installed
* {{%JAVA_HOME%}} and {{%JRE_HOME%}} are both pointed to the Java 11 instance 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install [AdoptOpenJDK11|https://adoptopenjdk.net/releases.html?variant=openjdk11&jvmVariant=hotspot#x64_win] on a Windows Server instance
# Set the system environment variables {{JAVA_HOME}} and {{JRE_HOME}} to point to the installed JDK from the previous step
# Download and run the Bitbucket Windows installer, opting to install the Windows services automatically

h3. Expected Results

* The bundled JRE is not extracted into {{%BITBUCKET_INSTALL%}}
* The Windows Services are configured to use the configured {{%JRE_HOME%\bin\server\jvm.dll}}, which points to AdoptOpenJDK11
* The {{JRE_HOME}} value in the {{set-jre-home.bat}} script is set to where AdoptOpenJDK11 was installed

h3. Actual Results

* The bundled JRE is extracted into the {{%BITBUCKET_INSTALL%}} directory
* The Windows Service is configured to use the bundled JRE
* The {{set-jre-home.bat}} script's {{JRE_HOME}} entry is set to use the bundled JRE

h3. Notes

* The issue does *not* occur when JDK8 is installed instead. Bitbucket doesn't include the bundled JRE, and the services/scripts are configured appropriately.

h3. Workaround

Following the installation, manually [configure the Windows services|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserverkb/how-to-update-the-jvm-configuration-for-a-windows-service-800715342.html] to use the Java 11 instance.
fields.summary: Windows installer does not recognize installed JDK11 instances

fields.description: You are able to ping reviewers by @ mentioning them in a comment. But in the interest of keeping the overview screen clearer, have a button where you can "poke" or send reminder emails to reviewers/approvers on pull requests.
fields.summary: Ability to ping reviewers manually

fields.description:
Any in-line comments on the Diff view for a pull request either show up in-line (on the line that the comment was made) or in the overview sections with all the other history.

It may be helpful to have an option where on the Diff screen there is a column that just has a list of those comments (able to be sorted by date or line number) to keep the code that is being looked at clean and easier to navigate from comment to comment.
fields.summary: Consolidation of pull request in-line comments

fields.description:
Sometimes the default rename-threshold (50%) is not appropriate for a change. It would be ideal if the threshold could be changed on a per PR or commit basis.

BSERV-3249 addresses customizing this on a per-project basis.
fields.summary: Allow rename thresholds to be specified on a per-pull request basis

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When activating the 'Hide comments' option in the pull request diff and then add a comment, all comments become visible, however the 'Hide comments' option remains activate. Comments can get hidden again by unselecting and selecting again the 'Hide comments option.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select 'Hide comments' in a pull request diff
 # Create a line comment
 # All comments become visible but the 'Hide comments' option remains active.

h3. Expected Results

The 'Hide comments' option becomes deselected when adding a comment.
h3. Actual Results

The comments appear but the option 'Hide comments' remains active.
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Hide comments option remains active when adding a comment on a pull request diff after comments were hidden

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

I'm excited to share that in Bitbucket Server 7.0 we shipped redesigned and optimized pull request page. The new page has fast and smooth scrolling on side-by-side diffs of any size.

You can find more information in the Bitbucket Server 7.0 [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-7-0-release-notes-990546638.html] and Pull Requests [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/review-and-discuss-a-pull-request-808488540.html].

Please, don't hesitate to leave feedback on the feature in the comments. This will help us to priorities further development.

Anton Genkin
Product Manager Bitbucket Server
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

When comparing file versions using the side-by-side view and using the search function on the left or right side of the compare view to find some words in the content, you can use buttons to search again (arrow up or down). After pressing the buttons several times you can scroll up and down the diff to see that the sides to not match to each other. 

The content of the left and the right side is shifted and the red and green markers make no sense anymore.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
# Enable side-by-side-diff on a compare view with a file with lots of changes.
# Select the left or right side with a mouse click.
# Press CTRL+F to search for a word contained multiple times in the text.
# Use the search down or up arrow buttons multiple times (fast).
# Scroll up and down the scrollbar to check if left and right side match to each other.

h3. Expected Results

The two files in the diff are still aligned.

h3. Actual Results

The files get misaligned.

 !image.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Refresh the page.
fields.summary: Content of side-by-side diff does not match after searching and scrolling

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Update these docs [https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/bitbucket-data-center-faq-776663707.html] and [https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/install-bitbucket-data-center-872139817.html] By adding "nfsvers=3" to mount options for NFS. 
h3. Notes

Slack message request by:

[~alevinson] "we have listed mount options for NFS and they are a bit off. There is an issue where the latest version of NFS is STUPID slow compared to the earlier version. So we always end up telling our customers to add "nfsvers=3" to their mount options
 
We have a feature request for using nfsv4, but our documentation doesn't mention it anywhere so we have this come up a lot
if we could add it so that nfs lookupcache=pos,noatime,intr,rsize=32768,wsize=32768 0 0 turns into nfs nfsvers=3 lookupcache=pos,noatime,intr,rsize=32768,wsize=32768 0 0 (edited) 
we could avoid a lot of those issues. And i would be happy to put in a ticket. i just.. don't know.. where"
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Update doc with NFS mount option to help support tell customers to add "nfsvers=3" to mount options

fields.description:
Hello, 

We encountered the following situation : Confluence and Bitbucket installed on the same Data Center and Collaborative editing does not work anymore because both applications use the same hazelcast port : 5701. 

We followed a procedure to change Synchrony's hazelcast port which solved the issue for the moment. 

I would have understood the issue if the port was in use by other Vendor's application, but I recommend Atlassian to use a different port for it's own applications. 

 

Can you please take this into consideration for the next releases? 

 

Best Regards,

Alin
fields.summary: Change hazelcast port 5701 for Bitbucket or Confluence/Synchrony

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of July 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#B2D4FF | titleBGColor=#B2D4FF | bgColor=#EAF1FC}
Microsoft has not released any major updates for IE11 since 2015, and has [recently discouraged the use of IE11 as a default browser|https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Windows-IT-Pro-Blog/The-perils-of-using-Internet-Explorer-as-your-default-browser/ba-p/331732].

To allow us to continue to take advantage of modern web standards to deliver improved functionality and the best possible user experience across all of our products, we have decided to end support for IE11. *Bitbucket 6.10 (LTS) is the last IE11-supported version.*

End of support means we will not fix bugs that are specific to IE11, and will begin to introduce features that aren't compatible with this browser.

Find out more about this change from our [announcement|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Feedback-Forum-articles/Retiring-IE11-support-for-Atlassian-cloud-server-and-data-center/ba-p/1185312].

If you have questions or concerns about this change, please comment on this issue.

{panel}
fields.summary: Plans to end support for IE11

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Bitbucket Server's DMZ API (introduced in 6.0.0) is for internal use only and was not intended to be available to third party apps. Ability to OSGi import com.atlassian.bitbucket.dmz needs to be prevented just like other internal API.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

In a P2 plugin import and use something from the com.atlassian.bitbucket.dmz namespace, such as the DmzStorageService.

h3. Expected Results

The DmzStorageService should not be accessible, its functionality is even documented in the [API changelog|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/bitbucket/reference/api-changelog/] as being unavailable:

Removal of direct access to repositories on disk

In Bitbucket Server 5.10 direct access to the Bitbucket managed repositories on disk for plugins was deprecated. In 6.0 the deprecated API that permitted this has been removed. For further information please refer to the changelog entry for 5.10.

h3. Actual Results

Plugin can use the DmzStorageService and other internal classes in the com.atlassian.bitbucket.dmz namespace.

h3. Workaround

Plugins can be updated to not utilise com.atlassian.bitbucket.dmz
fields.summary: Plugins can access Bitbucket's internal DMZ API

fields.description:
Summary:

We found that whenever a user(initiator) post a pull request or when they reply to review comments in my pull request , the author/initiator does not get the email notification. We referred the below documentation & found the comment "You don't receive notifications for events you initiate yourself" in it.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/pull-request-notifications-949754837.html

Our requirement is that the initiator also should get the notification when they post a new pull request . Do we have any alternative solution to this.

We would like to have a settings so that  the performer or initiator is always notified of any changes/edits made by others or by myself.
fields.summary: As a Bitbucket Server user I would like to receive an email notification for my own pull request actions

fields.description:
Many years ago (in internet time), when my organization was just using Subversion, I integrated SmartBear Collaborator into our process.  One thing that I really liked about this tool was that it tried hard to ensure that all review participants saw all the code review comments.  It did this by forcing participants to mark each comment as "read".  When entering a review, you could clearly see if there were any unread comments, and a quick way to get to the unread ones. While paging through the comments, it would highlight the unread comments in yellow, so you couldn't miss them.

Now we have git and BitBucket, and it wasn't really viable to continue using Collaborator (Collaborator does have a Bitbucket integration, but I had no influence over the enterprise Bitbucket integration to make this a possibility).

The pull request view in Bitbucket has some niceties, but what I find with working with many developers in our organization is that many of them miss comments they need to see.  As comments are tied to commits, they are often lost when viewing code in the "Diff" panel (as they will usually be using the "all commits" choice).  The only place they would be able to see all comments is by scrolling down on the Overview page.  We integrate the SonarQube plugin, which results in the start of the comments section to appear right at the bottom of the screen, leaving any real comments only visible by scrolling past the end of the first page.

If developers or authors forget to do this, they simply don't see the comments, and they approve or merge PRs without noticing the issues they need to discuss.

We also send email for each comment, but that depends on developers managing their email tool well enough to make this effective.  Many of the devs in our organization seem to not do this well.

I suggest you implement a feature set that does something like what Collaborator does, which would require storing a record for each participant/pr pair, and an entry for each comment, indicating whether that participant has seen that comment, and a visual indicator of such.
fields.summary: Provide more assurance that pull request participants see all code review comments

fields.description:
Scenario: We have a Stash Admin team, which creates Projects and also creates repositories on request of different Teams. It would be great to have a little fine-grained access control built into Stash where we can have an Organisation level admins and Project level admins with configurable access controls for these project-level admins.

Eg. Project level admins can have limited (configurable) capabilities as compared to Organisation level Admins.

_"I wish stash had a feature where I could pass on the create repo access without passing in full admin access" - Real pain point from a member of our Admin Team_
fields.summary: Allow individual users access to create repository in a Project without giving out full admin access

fields.description:
In Bitbucket Server (5+) there are no build-in post-receive repository hooks. To enable them one first has to add one (either free or paid from the Atlassian Marketplace.

The documentation [POST service webhook for Bitbucket Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/post-service-webhook-for-bitbucket-server-776640367.html] on how to enable a post hook, is missing a step.

h4. Suggested resolution
Modify the steps to include
# Set up in the repository settings
# Go to the repository's settings.
# Click Hooks in the left-hand navigation.
# Click  *Add Hook*, which will direct you to the Marketplace to choose an appropriate plugin, for example "Post-Receive WebHooks", and install it. 
# Click Enable for the 'Post-Receive Webhooks' item. You can add up to 5 URLs for where Bitbucket Server should send its update messages.
Press Save.
fields.summary: Post hooks documentation missing a step

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issue raised by an app vendor in DEVHELP:
{quote}
Reproducing is easy. 
1. Install the latest Kantega SSO for Bitbucket on Bitbucket 6.6.1 using UPM.
2. Observe stack trace

Our addon fails to install on Bitbucket 6.6.1. It's a transformer-plugin. The exception is:
{code}
Caused by: org.osgi.framework.BundleException: Unable to resolve no.kantega.kerberosauth.kerberosauth-plugin.stash [121](R 121.0): missing requirement [no.kantega.kerberosauth.kerberosauth-plugin.stash [121](R 121.0)] osgi.wiring.package; (&(osgi.wiring.package=com.atlassian.bitbucket.dmz.permission)(version>=6.6.1)(version<=6.6.1)) Unresolved requirements: [[no.kantega.kerberosauth.kerberosauth-plugin.stash [121](R 121.0)] osgi.wiring.package; (&(osgi.wiring.package=com.atlassian.bitbucket.dmz.permission)(version>=6.6.1)(version<=6.6.1))]at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix.resolveBundleRevision(Felix.java:4149)... 30 common frames omitted2019-09-05 08:52:26,607 ERROR [spring-startup]  c.a.plugin.manager.PluginEnabler Unable to enable plugin no.kantega.kerberosauth.kerberosauth-plugin.stashcom.atlassian.plugin.osgi.container.OsgiContainerException: Cannot start plugin: no.kantega.kerberosauth.kerberosauth-plugin.stash
{code}

This works fine on Bitbucket 6.6.0.

In terms of AMPS config, we have no custom OSGi instructions so the MANIFEST.MF is completely generated during the transformer/install phase. In the transformered(tm) version under /bitbucket/home/plugins/.osgi-cache/transformed-plugins/, I find this, among other things, this: 

com.atlassian.bitbucket.dmz.permission;version="[6.6.0,6.6.0]"

Looks good. Works fine. 

Now, when deploying on 6.6.1, then in MANIFEST.MF I similarly find a generated statement saying:

com.atlassian.bitbucket.dmz.permission;version="[6.6.1,6.6.1]"

However, this time the package fails to resolve causing the missing requirement message/stack trace above.

Looking at the OSGi browser, the package version 6.6.1 is available and exported by the System bundle, so I don't know why it fails to resolve. It also has resolution optional, so could you advice on why this appears to be working on 6.6.0 and not 6.6.1? This is HIGHLY critical for us as customers on 6.6.1 are already affected and can no longer install the addon. We have yet to find a way around this. By extension, it also means we currently have no way forward on Bitbucket and I'm worried that whichever change triggered this will find its way into newer releases on the rest of the Atlassian portfolio sooner rather than later (I assume the transformer/UPM stuff is all mostly shared libraries).

I've tried adding an OSGi instruction making the package optional and with a wider version range (though I didn't expect either to work - we don't even use this package directly but I assume it's pulled in transitively by us including bitbucket-api and bitbucket-spi). Now, the Import-Package statement actually gets changed to mandatory in the transformed JAR. The version also gets mangled somehow with an asterisk added to the end (not sure if this is significant or not). In any case the resolution fails. Example:

<Import-Package>com.atlassian.bitbucket.dmz.permission;resolution:="optional";version:="[5.0,6.6.2)"*;resolution:="optional"</Import-Package>

This yields a transformed MANIFEST.MF containing:

com.atlassian.bitbucket.dmz.permission;resolution:="mandatory";version:="[5.0,6.6.2)*"
{quote}

h3. Expected Results
Addon installs and finds package

h3. Actual Results
org.osgi.framework.BundleException missing requirement

h3. Notes
From vendor:
{quote}
It may also be of interest to you that we had one customer reporting similar problems with some other plugins on 6.6.1 as well (I'm not familiar with any of them): 

Customer says:
"Similar behavior is also occurring on MIBEX plugins:

Repository Dashboard for Bitbucket Server
Repository Templates for Bitbucket Server
Sonar for Bitbucket Server"
{quote}

h3. Workaround
From vendor:
{quote}
We ended up hastily rewriting the plugin base to spring-scanner-1 over the weekend. This seems to have worked around the problem so this is no longer an issue for us.

The last reproducible version would be Kantega SSO 3.6.3, just in case you want to look into it (3.6.5 onwards is now transformerless). 
{quote}
fields.summary: Addon install cannot resolve "com.atlassian.bitbucket.dmz.permission" on Bitbucket 6.6.1

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When declining a PR, the refs/pull-request/<PR ID> is not recreated when the PR is reopened

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a pull request
 # Navigate to <Bitbucket shared>/data/repositories/<repo slug>/refs/pull-requests
 # Note the ID of your PR exists
 # Decline the PR and note that the PR ID is gone (expected)
 # Reopen the PR

h3. Expected Results
The directory for the PR is recreated

h3. Actual Results
The directory for the PR is *not* recreated

h3. Workaround

Pushing any change to the master or source branch before *OR* after the PR is reopened will cause the directory to be created when the PR is open.
fields.summary: Pull Request refs are not recreated on re-open.

fields.description:
While the commit graph implemented under BSERV-2534 is certainly useful on its own, as a build manager it's substantially more useful to have the option to see all of the branches and their related commits at any given time.

While I can use the Branches view to see which branches have been merged but not yet deleted, it becomes more difficult to track parallel work within a single repository (such as a multi-team environment working in one repo, where each team may have their own development branch that gets later merged into a combined development/master branch prior to release).

While the [Commit Graph for Bitbucket Server|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219256/commit-graph-for-bitbucket-server?hosting=server] extension provides a lot of functionality for filtering and searching along with its All Branches Graph, it would be nice if Bitbucket Server supported a minimal All Branches Graph (extra features optional).
fields.summary: Add an "All Branches" view to the Commit Graph

fields.description:
Bitbucket Server & Bitbucket Data Center had an argument injection vulnerability, allowing an attacker to inject additional arguments into Git commands, which could lead to remote code execution. Remote attackers can exploit this argument injection vulnerability if they are able to access a Git repository in Bitbucket Server or Bitbucket Data Center. If public access is enabled for a project or repository, then attackers are able to exploit this issue anonymously.

*Affected versions:*
 * All versions of Bitbucket Server & Bitbucket Data Center before 5.16.10 (the fixed version for 5.16.x ), from 6.0.0 before 6.0.10 (the fixed version for 6.0.x), from 6.1.0 before 6.1.8 (the fixed version for 6.1.x), from 6.2.0 before 6.2.6 (the fixed version for 6.2.x), from 6.3.0 before 6.3.5 (the fixed version for 6.3.x), from 6.4.0 before 6.4.3 (the fixed version for 6.4.x), and from 6.5.0 before 6.5.2 (the fixed version for 6.5.x) are affected by this vulnerability. 

h3. *What You Need to Do*

Atlassian recommends that you upgrade to the latest version. For a full description of the latest version of Bitbucket Server & Bitbucket Data Center, see the [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-6-6-release-notes-975023322.html]. You can download the latest version of Bitbucket Server from the [download center.|https://www.atlassian.com/software/bitbucket/download]

*Fix*:
* Bitbucket Server & Bitbucket Data Center 6.6.1 contains a fix available for download from [here|https://www.atlassian.com/software/bitbucket/download/]

* Bitbucket Server & Bitbucket Data Center 6.6.0 contains a fix available for download from [here|https://www.atlassian.com/software/bitbucket/download-archives]

* Bitbucket Server & Bitbucket Data Center 6.5.2 contains a fix available for download from [here|https://www.atlassian.com/software/bitbucket/download-archives]

* Bitbucket Server & Bitbucket Data Center 6.4.3 contains a fix available for download from [here|https://www.atlassian.com/software/bitbucket/download-archives]

* Bitbucket Server & Bitbucket Data Center 6.3.5 contains a fix available for download from [here|https://www.atlassian.com/software/bitbucket/download-archives]

* Bitbucket Server & Bitbucket Data Center 6.2.6 contains a fix available for download from [here|https://www.atlassian.com/software/bitbucket/download-archives]

* Bitbucket Server & Bitbucket Data Center 6.1.8 contains a fix available for download from [here|https://www.atlassian.com/software/bitbucket/download-archives]

* Bitbucket Server & Bitbucket Data Center 6.0.10 contains a fix available for download from [here|https://www.atlassian.com/software/bitbucket/download-archives]

* Bitbucket Server & Bitbucket Data Center 5.16.10 contains a fix available for download from [here|https://www.atlassian.com/software/bitbucket/download-archives]

h3. *Mitigation*

To help mitigate the issue, we have a hotfix available in the form of a plugin that can be enabled with zero downtime. You do not require the hotfix if you are already on a fixed version of Bitbucket, and the hotfix will refuse to install on any fixed version.
{panel:bgColor=#ffffce}
The hotfix works for Bitbucket Server and Bitbucket Data Center instances and can be used to protect systems while planning and executing an upgrade to a fixed version.

Please note that installed apps may still introduce vulnerabilities, even with the hotfix installed. The hotfix only protects the _standard_ _functionality_ of Bitbucket.
{panel}
*This hotfix covers:*
 * Standard Bitbucket functionality and features
 * Bitbucket Server and Data Center versions 4.0.0 and later
 * Bitbucket Server and Data Center instances

h4. To install the hotfix:

This hotfix is a _zero down time installation_ - No restart is required after installing the hotfix.
 # Login to Bitbucket with your administrator account
 # Go to Administration (cog wheel) and navigate to “Addons” → “Manage apps“
 # Select “Upload App” and provide the URL: {{[^bitbucket-bserv-11896-hotfix-1.0.0.jar]}}
 # Click “Upload” and wait for the hotfix to install.

If you are unable to upload the hotfix with the URL provided or Bitbucket is behind a firewall, you can download the hotfix plugin Jar from this issue. You are then able to upload the Jar file using the same steps above.

After upgrading to a fixed version there’s no need to remove the hotfix manually; it will be uninstalled automatically as part of the upgrade process.

 

For additional details, see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/Czc4Og].
fields.summary: Argument Injection - CVE-2019-15000

fields.description:
On Bitbucket I can’t click a [Merge] button until a diff has approvals, and has finished building. Sometimes I’ll forget to check that diff and hit the button for an entire weekend, etc.

I’d like to be able to set a diff to [Auto-Merge When Ready].
fields.summary: Merge-when-ready button

fields.description: Ability to create a bunch of draft comments and when I’m ready to actually approve the PR, give me a chance to review that the comments are still valid. And if they are, go ahead and post all of my draft comments with my approval.
fields.summary: Ability to post draft comments at a later date.

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*
A team of developers is set as reviewers of pull requests, but on some cases they would be committers of those Pull Request as well, which causes them to be both the contributor and the reviewer of the PR.

*Suggested Solution*
A feature which would read all of the committers of the Pull request and block those users from being able to approve this specific PR.

In a scenario, where a team of 10 developers, 4 worked on a PR, but all of them are set as  reviewers, the idea is for only those other 6 which didn't contributed to the pull request to be able to approve/review this specific PR.

At this moment, nothing blocks the users that is set as a default reviewer and perform a commit on a PR, to be able to approve and merge the PR.
fields.summary: Ability to block committer from being Reviewer or Approving the PR

fields.description:
h2. Problem / Use case

A user has recently deleted a repository by mistake, however it is still needed by other members of the team. There are no single backups of this repository and no developers have a local clone of this repository. Even if there were a local clone, the metadata associated with the repository (configuration, pull requests, etc.) are not available to be restored.
h2. Possible solutions
h3. Mark as deleted

Mark a repository as deleted and keep all metadata and the repository on disk intact but inaccessible.
 - A server or system administrator could then go ahead and permanently delete any such repositories; or
 - A scheduled cleanup could be performed on a configurable timeout (e.g. automatically clean up repositories that are marked as deleted after 60 days)

h3. Delete with backup

Prior to the actual deletion of a repository, automatically create a backup of the current state of the repository and make this accessible to download to administrators.
 - A server or system administrator could then permanently delete this backup once they have a local copy or it is no longer needed.
 - A scheduled cleanup could be performed on a configurable timeout to delete old backup files.

h2. Related issues and information

If you'd like more information about restoring an accidentally deleted repository, please [read our knowledge base article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserverkb/restore-a-deleted-repository-for-bitbucket-server-942841062.html] about this, however note that it requires a backup of some sort to be available, either in the form of a proper backup or a local clone of the repository.

Note that there is a very similar feature request open for restoring a repository and all its details from a backup. This issue is specifically about Bitbucket Server preserving the data and state of a repository in some way upon deletion so that it can be seamlessly restored without the use of an external backup.

There are [several recommended and supported backup strategies|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/data-recovery-and-backups-776640050.html], please be sure to use the right backup strategy for your individual needs.
fields.summary: As a repository administrator I would like to restore a recently deleted repository

fields.description:
h3. Summary(Customer's use case)
Customer realized a "tag push" was made to the wrong repository, then had to delete all the tags but realized all commits "unreachables" were not deleted and had to delete them manually.
h3. Expected result
Please we would like to have an option that allows tags to be deleted with their corresponding commits.

Thank you.
fields.summary: When tags are deleted, provide an option to delete all related commits

fields.description:
Currently some of the user base would like to avoid the usage of the moved button mouse-over functionality.

When files get moved from one folder to another in Bitbucket this change is indicated by having a moved button available which needs to be mouse-overed in order to display the from and to information.

The users would like to have, like in commit_summary.png, a more visible (and obvious) possibility to show that the files have been moved.

Thank you very much for considering this change

Best Regards

Sebastian
fields.summary: Replace "file moved" tooltip with inline equivalent

fields.description:
h3. Summary(Customer's usecase)
Within Jira, we have made the custom *{{team field mandatory}}*. This is necessary for our *{{planning department}}*. However, we are currently experiencing problems when creating a Jira issue from a pull request in Bitbucket because the team field is not available. Our *{{development department}}* is bothered by this because creating an issue now has to be created through Jira and takes more time.

h3. Expected result
Please we would like to see custom fields added to the screen when you create a Jira issue from Bitbucket pull request.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Add custom fields when creating Jira issue from Bitbucket pull request

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When installing Bitbucket as a Smart Mirror, an local Elasticsearch instance is also started.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Download Bitbucket installer (tested with 6.5.0)
 # Use the installation wizard to install a smart mirror instance

h3. Expected Results

Bitbucket (mirror) instance is started with {{--no-search}} option and no elasticsearch service is run
h3. Actual Results

An elasticsearch service is also started up
h3. Workaround
 # Restart Bitbucket instance with {{--no-search}} option
 # Re-install Bitbucket service with the {{--no-elasticsearch}} option
{code:bash}
cd $BITBUCKET_INSTALL/bin
./install_linux_service.sh --no-elasticsearch
{code}
fields.summary: Installing Smart Mirror also starts an Elasticsearch instance

fields.description:
Currently any user with write access to a repository can force unlock an LFS file that was locked by someone else by using the {{--force}} flag or confirming in the UI that they want to remove the lock. 

In some cases it may be desirable to only allow lock owners and repository administrators to remove a lock. 

If a user doesn't have the privilege to unlock a file, then the unlock button should be hidden in the UI.
fields.summary: Allow configuring of Git LFS force unlocking permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When attempting to monitor user traffic, for health check purposes, errors that are gracefully handled by Bitbucket and thrown to clients are paired with an HTTP 200 rather than an error code matching to the message displayed. This makes using an F5, or other load balancer options, to monitor traffic for 500 class errors not possible as all errors are matched with a 200 OK indicating that the error message was successfully sent. 

h3. Environment
* Bitbucket Data Center 5.16.1
* F5 Load Balancer utilizing [passive monitoring|https://devcentral.f5.com/s/articles/back-to-basics-health-monitors-and-load-balancing]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Setup a standard Data Center environment
* Encounter an error, typically caused by running out of SCM-command tickets which prompts a "Server Busy" Error page
* Review Status code of HTTP header

h3. Expected Results
A 503 or appropriate 500 Class Status should be sent from Bitbucket to the client when displaying an error page.

h3. Actual Results
200 OK sent.

h3. Workaround
Utilize the [/status health check endpoint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserverkb/how-to-monitor-if-bitbucket-server-is-up-and-running-975014635.html] to determine if the node is in an ERROR state rather than passively monitoring user traffic.
fields.summary: Errors seen within the Web UI are not matched with appropriate/matching HTTP errors codes on page load

fields.description:
There are several buttons in my comment:

!image-2019-08-29-13-03-23-562.png!

Can we add a share button?

Currently, if I want to share my comment, I have to:
 # Copy the link of my pull request
 # Inspect the <li> of my comment, get the commend id
 # Add `?commentId=XXXX` to the link of the pull request to get the shareable link
fields.summary: Share button for comment in pull request

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, in Bitbucket Server, it is not possible to import metadata such as Pull Requests History neither using the [out of the box feature to import code from an existing project to a BB server instance|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/importing-code-from-an-existing-project-776640909.html] nor using [REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/bitbucket-server/rest/6.6.0/bitbucket-rest.html].

Note: For Data Center, such a feature is provided via the *[Data Center Migration for Admins|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/data-center-migration-957497834.html]* tool for Server TO Data Center or Data Center TO Data Center migrations.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a tool that would import this metadata via UI.

OR

provide a REST API endpoint.
h3. Why this is important

For Bitbucket Cloud users, Bitbucket Server users, Gitlab users etc... who consider migrating data to a Bitbucket Server such a feature would be a great add to not loose Pull Requests history (for example).
h3. Workaround

Currently, a valid option would be to consider purchasing a Data Center license.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want a REST API endpoint to import metadata such as Pull Requests History

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Nowadays, the [{{GET /rest/api/1.0/admin/groups/more-members}}|https://docs.atlassian.com/bitbucket-server/rest/6.6.0/bitbucket-rest.html#idp10] REST API endpoint does not retrieve each user's creation date, and that information might be useful for our customers.

h4. Example use case
I would like to revoke accounts for users that have not logged in in the last 2 months, and I am going to use the authentication timestamp for that, but for users who have never even logged in, I would need to know when the account was created.

h3. Suggested Solution
Include the user's creation date to the response. This information is stored at database level, in the {{CWD_USER.CREATED_DATE}} column.

h3. Workaround
There are no known workarounds yet for retrieving that information via REST API.
fields.summary: REST API for obtaining users list should retrieve the user created date

fields.description:
Currently Bitbucket notifies when the Bitbucket license itself is expiring, but does not notify if a plugin is getting close to expiring. Expired plugins lead to a loss of functionality.

While this info is displayed in the UPM, admins will not be aware of them unless they regularly visits the Universal Plugin Manager to check, which they may not do often. Please note that this is also not displayed or notified via my.atlassian.com

It is proposed that these notifications take the form of pop-ups such as the the "End of Life" warnings.
fields.summary: Notification of upcoming add-on license expiration

fields.description:
Projects and Repositories show as Public (with the label) even when feature.public.access=false

Steps to Duplicate:
 * Ensure that public access is enabled
 * Mark a project and\or repository as public
 * Disable public access and restart
 * Visit the project list and you will see that even though public access is disabled the projects that were public have the public tag.  This is the same for repositories that were public.

This has been verified in Bitbucket 5 and 6.  The projects and repositories are not actually public
fields.summary: Projects and Repositories show as Public even when feature.public.access=false

No forks are visible in repository unless Bitbucket is restarted.
h3. Environment
Bitbucket 6.5.1

 # Upgrade or install Bitbucket 6.5.1
 # Create a new repository or use a repository with no forks.
 # Create a fork
 # Navigate back to the original repository and view forks.

To see the fork listed as a fork.

No forks are listed.

h3. Notes
Upgrading from Bitbucket 6.4, if  the repository has an existing fork, this works as expected.  

(Optional - If Necessary)

Restart Bitbucket

As a Bitbucket administrator, I would like to have an option to disable this link so that it does not show up at all.

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Code search does not have consistent highlighting with dots and underscores. For example it currently highlights correctly (the entire search term is highlighted) when searching for terms such as:
{code:java}
object.Property
object.property{code}
However only part of the search term is highlighted when searching for:
{code:java}
object.someProperty
object.SomeProperty
object_property.property{code}
h3. Environment

Elasticsearch v.6.5.3 or v6.6.1

Bitbucket Server 6.0 and above
h3. Workaround

Currently no workaround. Search results are still accurate even though the full phrase is not highlighted.
fields.summary: Code search does not have consistent highlighting with dots, underscores and camelcase

fields.description: Cannot add comments in the bitbuckets Pull Requests side by side view.
fields.summary: PR Sde by Side view needs to Add Comments

fields.description:
It would be very nice to be able to mark specific Jira issues (NOT all of them) that are linked to a Pull Request as "Needs Resolution", preventing the merge from taking place until that specific issue is closed.

Again, this is not a request to make ALL linked Jira issues hard blockers of the merge, as it is very common to link to parent issues that will not be closed until after the pull request is complete.

While many of us appreciate the simplicity of pull requests, the lack of available process enforcement is a show-stopper for some folks. Having the ability to block PR closure based off the status of a Jira issue would be enough to allow programs with some of these more strict process requirements to use Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Ability to mark certain linked Jira issues as "Needs Resolution"

fields.description: Crucible allows the user to create Sub-tasks of previously-linked Jira issues from a review. It would be nice to have similar functionality in Bitbucket. It looks like we cannot create Sub-tasks from Bitbucket pull requests, even when a Jira issue that works with Sub-tasks is already linked to the PR.
fields.summary: Add ability to create Sub-tasks to Pull Requests

fields.description:
In Bitbucket we a add default reviewers and add a requirement for an X number of aprovers before code is allowed to be merged.
There should be a way of requiring an aproval from 1 of Y developers (ie. 1 LEAD must aprove) before its mergeable.
This way we dont get juniors aproving eachothers PR's and merging before a senior even gets a chance to look at the code.
fields.summary: Require Specific Aprover Before Merge

fields.description:
Hey,

It seems that the REST end-point [https://docs.atlassian.com/bitbucket-server/rest/5.8.0/bitbucket-build-rest.html#idm45498661394656] is not returning a paged response. It is always the 100 most recent build-statuses that are returned.

This is limiting us a lot since we are having pipelines where commits might have more than 100 builds attached.

Would it be possible to make this a paged API as most other REST end-points provide?
fields.summary: Build Status REST end-point is not a paged API

fields.description:
In Bitbucket, readme.md files are displayed on the source page. 

Would like for this functionality to be extended to also display Jupyter Notebook (ipynb) files.

GitHub displays these files correctly.
fields.summary: Display correctly Jupyter files in Bitbucket

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a Jira issue from a Bitbucket Pull Request comment, Bitbucket does not retain the default value for the issue security field

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue security scheme in Jira and assign the scheme to one of your Jira projects.
 # Set a default issue security level in your Jira issue security scheme. 
 # From the Bitbucket Pull Request, create a Jira issue for the chosen project

h3. Expected Results

In the modal window, the issue security field should default to your default issue security level
h3. Actual Results

The issue security level selected is the first from all the levels sorted alphabetically. Not the default one.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Bitbucket does not retrieve the default value for the Jira issue security level field

fields.description:
We add the name of our internal projects to Jira issues using square parentheses (eg:  [Jira], [Bitbucket], ... ). The resulting branch names become `Jira]-branch...`, which cannot be copied into a terminal from the 'git fetch and checkout' tool.

Better would be to either remove these chars from the generated branch name, or to add quotes around the branch name
fields.summary: Git checkout command add quotes or remove terminal chars

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Bitbucket is showing feature discovery pop-up for the newly created users for certain cases: ie creation of new branch.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new users for each browsers: ie, firefox, chrome
# Log in with each users in corresponding browsers
# Go to any repository and open "Branches" tab
# Click menu button ("three dots") to the right from branch selector and choose "Create a new branch from here"
# Type in the new branch name and click "Create branch" button

h3. Expected Results

Feature discovery is shown for all new users in all browsers as on the screenshot.
 !Screenshot 2019-08-19 at 11.52.07.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
chrome user in Google Chrome 76 is showing correctly
firefox user in Mozilla Firefox 68 is not showing any pop-up - no error in JS or logs
ie user in MS Internet Explorer 11.678 is not showing any pop-ip - no error in JS or logs

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Feature discovery pop-up is not shown in Firefox and IE11 for branch creation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In case of migrating large repositories to Azure, if the push itself takes more than 30 minutes, users get 502 - bad gateway error. 
 The 30 minutes setting is set in Bitbucket App Gateway by default.
{code:java}
"properties": {
                            "provisioningState": "Succeeded",
                            "port": 7990,
                            "protocol": "Http",
                            "cookieBasedAffinity": "Enabled",
                            "pickHostNameFromBackendAddress": false,
                            "affinityCookieName": "AZURESESSIONID",
                            "requestTimeout": 1800
                        },
{code}
When deploying Bitbucket DC to Azure using our template, we can configure many parameters.
 However, backend requestTimeout is not one of them. 
 If we add this one parameter to the configuration template, we will make customers aware that if they expect large repositories to be imported, they might need to increase the timeout.

 
h3. Suggested Solution

Add configuring Bitbucket App Gateway requestTimeout to the deployment template.
fields.summary: Bitbucket in Azure - Allow configuring backendHttpSettingsCollection.requestTimeout for App Gateway  while deploying Bitbucket

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The {{application.wadl}} file provided by the Bitbucket REST API duplicates the API path in both the resource base and the resource path, leading to an invalid URL.

This also breaks integration with the [Atlassian REST API Browser|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211542/atlassian-rest-api-browser] plugin making it provide wrong REST resource URLs.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Access view-source:<BITBUCKET_URL>/rest/api/1.0/application.wadl

h3. Expected result
{{<ns2:resource>}} elements don't contain "{{api/1.0/}}" prefix
e.g.
{code}
    <ns2:resources base="https://test.mybitbucket.com/bitbucket/rest/api/1.0/">
        <ns2:resource path="projects/{projectKey}/repos">
{code}

h3. Actual result
{{<ns2:resource>}} elements contains "{{api/1.0/}}" prefix
e.g.
{code}
    <ns2:resources base="https://test.mybitbucket.com/bitbucket/rest/api/1.0/">
        <ns2:resource path="api/1.0/projects/{projectKey}/repos">
{code}

h3. Notes
The duplicated "{{api/1.0/}}" prefix breaks integration with [Atlassian REST API Browser|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211542/atlassian-rest-api-browser] plugin making it provide wrong REST resource URLs.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Implement a URL rewrite on a reverse proxy to redirect URLs made using the partially duplicated paths over to the actual, correct, path. Something akin to matching the following regex:

* {{^/rest/api/([0-9][.]?[0-9]?)/api/[0-9][.]?[0-9]?/(.*)$}}

And then replacing it with:

* {{/rest/api/$1/$2}}

(!) Note: If you're using a context path, make sure to include that in the URL rewrite - both in the matching regex, and the redirect value as well

While this workaround doesn't affect the incorrect display in the WADL file, it will ensure that any requests to the REST API will be redirected correctly to the same API; and allowing integrations using the WADL to function correctly (such as the REST API browser).
fields.summary: Bitbucket duplicates REST resource root path in WADL

fields.description: The current default avatar shows a 'John Doe' face, instead it would be very helpful if it showed the users initials.
fields.summary: Default user avatar should have users initials

fields.description:
Given a forked repository, and a PR into upstream - the initial WebHook {{pr:opened}} is triggered. However, subsequent updates/pushes to the source fork:branch does not trigger any WebHook events. This blocks downstream CI processes and updates are never re-built as there are no triggers for this.

Should there be an event for this?
fields.summary: WebHook event on updates to pull requests from forks

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When saving the Announcement Banner configuration with the Status set to "Off" will correctly save the configuration, however when visiting the page again it will not show the saved message and audience.

h3. Reproduction

1. Go to the rate limiting admin page
2. Set the status to "Off"
3. Add some text in the banner message field
4. Save the banner.
  You should now see a notification that states the banner has been saved.
5. Refresh the page

h3. Expected results

The saved banner settings are shown

h3. Actual results

The banner message is empty (and if changed from the default, the banner audience is reverted to the default value).

h3. Workaround

No workaround is available. Should one become available this issue will be updated.
fields.summary: Announcement banner does not visually persist settings when saving the banner with a status set to "off"
